data.title: Fried noodles
data.text: Been coming regularly for many years. Excellent service, great variety, served fresh.  Walking distance from court house. Good spot if you have to be there for jury duty.

data.title: Decent Cantonese
data.text: The restaurant is small and clean.  They weren't very busy and service was excellent.  The food was fresh, but wasn't as spicy as I would have liked.  Their hot & sour soup needed some more rice vinegar and the sesame chicken needed a kick.  Their Chinese Chicken Salad was an iceberg salad with steamed chicken on topped that was tossed in what tasted like the Asian Sesame Dressing from Costco.  Not the best Chinese I've ever eaten, but not the worst.

data.title: Place to go for Chinese food and martini's
data.text: Great food with the atmosphere of being around an old time acquaintance.  They could easily qualify for the  best value for food and spirits in the Palm Springs area.

data.title: Too much hurry to close
data.text: We come here from time to time, we like the food but we are always put off by the staff hassling to close up. For the last half hour before closing the constant sound of sweeping and the endless questions whether you need anything else make this a less than restful experience. If you only want to pay staff till 9pm, stop serving at 8! It has happened once too often for us, in future we'll go elsewhere or just get take-out. No one tries to sweep under my feet at home.

data.title: Delicious Chinese Cuisine in Indio
data.text: We love this place.  Peter (a master chef) and Lily are always so welcoming.  A great place for lunch and dinner.  Cocktails and beer and wine.  Quick lunches for work days.  A perfect spot for large gatherings as there is a back room with very large tables.

data.title: Great Food Great Service
data.text: My wife and i go to the China Bistro about twice a month.  We have never been disappointed and the service is always wonderful.  Lilly, the owner along with her husband who is the cook, always attend to our needs.  They are always plesent and the food is very good at decent prices.  They can be very busy during the Snow Bird season.  Tryit, you will like it.

data.title: Great welcome without a reservation
data.text:
We were a group of six Canadians who heard about the Chinese Bistro and decided to "take a chance" and just "show up" for a six o'clock supper.  There was none of the often heard "Do you have a reservation?  No? Well we'll see if we can find a table for you among the 10 that are empty".  [Sound familiar?]
We were greeted most pleasantly.  We were shown to a table for six.  Drink orders were taken after we had a moment to catch our breath and not as our butts were hitting the chairs. 
We received good advice on menu choices to share including a suggestion that we were starting to order too much.
We will go back.

data.title: Discontinued Happy Hour
data.text: We have been going to China Bistro for 3 years, they HAD the best Happy Hour, The food and the prices were great. They dropped their happy hour.

data.title: What a surprise
data.text: Walk into a beautiful restaurant with food that is very good and experience the best value in Indio. Our meals were made to order and the flavor so good you look forward to your next visit. And the service just be ready to smile and enjoy. Your every need is met

data.title: Good fresh food
data.text: We had a very good  dinner on a Saturday night. The food was very fresh tasting, not oily or like it was mass produced. The staff was very attentive. There were families as well as couples. We ordered Moo Shu Pork for the four of us. The hostess brought it to the table and put together the four servings for us, saving us from struggling to do that. We had a good experience. It is well worth the effort to find it.

data.title: An out of the way place not to be missed!
data.text: This place is off the beaten path but definitely should not be overlooked. It has a very unassuming frontage that would be overlooked should you happen to drive past - which is unlikely as it is not located on a major road. This is unfortunate as people would miss one of the best chinese eateries I've been to. The food is HOT and fresh. Very tasty. The staff is friendly and the food is served by I believe the cook who looks like he takes great pride of his food. Please don't bypass this gem!

data.title: Delicous and Authentic Chinese Food
data.text: I have eaten here twice and each time I was served a delicious dish.  On my first visit I had the chicken with vegetables and on the second visit I ordered Almond Chicken.  Both meals were fresh and tasty.  Prices are affordable and the service is great.  I highly recommend this rstaurant!

data.title: Mucho moo goo
data.text: Great family restaurant. Good choices for lunch specials. Ample parking good service and reasonable prices. Walking distance from court house.

data.title: The freshest Chinese food ever!
data.text: Living in the desert does not present many opportunities for delicious Chinese Food.  Having lived here for 12 years and never finding any restaurant to my satisfaction, I was pleasantly surprised when my husband found a hidden gem in Indio.  All of the food is so fresh and wonderful.  You can tell that nothing is canned or frozen and the portions are very large.  They are closed on Mondays.

data.title: Something besides Mexican food
data.text: Heading home and wanted something besides Mexican food. Found this place and most of the reviews were good. Well we really enjoyed our meals and service. Cloth table covers were a nice touch. Good price for the amount of food. Some left to take home. If I lived closer I'd go again.

data.title: outstanding food at low prices
data.text: We let Mr.. Gamin choose our eating establishment last night.  What a fantastic place with food to drool over and prices the best you will see.  It seemed to be a family owned and run place with a wide variety of food available.  From all the noises of exclamation we heard from other diners of how outstanding the food was, it was our pleasure to eat there.

data.title: Great meal
data.text: 4 of us order the "B" meal for 4 people and it was great.  Lots of food and enough for lunch the next day.  Love the Happy Family!  All fresh vegetables and the rice is wonderful.  Lots of seafood and chicken in the dishes.

data.title: One of Best Chinese Restaurants in Coachella Valley
data.text:
I always preface local reviews of Asian restaurants by saying,  "This is not the Bay Area."
However, China Bistro is a simple, quiet, clean, pleasant restaurant, with good, reasonably priced food, which gets my vote for the best Chinese restaurant in the Coachella Valley.  I have eaten here several times and not been disappointed. You will not find shark fin soup nor camphor-smoked duck on the menu. But you will find dishes prepared with care, flavor, and good fresh ingredients that are tasty, well presented, and look attractive on the plate. I have had Beef Chow Fun (medium wide, not traditional 2-inch wide noodles), several lunch specials, and a simple Special Lomein. Service is also very good. Whether you  are dining alone or with friends, you will not be ignored. (I also appreciated little touches like a container of fresh jasmine blooms in the women's room.) There are lunch specials from about 11 AM to 3 PM, starting at about $8.00. A single entree for dinner, starting at about $8.00,  is more than enough for one person.  There is usually adequate parking on the street in front.  The only reason that I do not give this place a "five" is because the menu is not the least bit adventurous. But they do the old standards very well, better than anyone else in the Coachella Valley.
Please note:  the older central part of Indio, where this restaurant is located, is undergoing construction, landscaping, and signage upgrades.  This restaurant is located on Towne St., between the Indio library and Highway 111, closer to 111.  Many street signs have been removed temporarily.  Towne St. is parallel to Jackson and about three blocks west of it.
Towne St. begins on the north side of Highway 111 and does not cross it.      Enjoy.

data.title: Very good Chinese Food
data.text: We tried this place on a recommendation and were very glad we did.  The food was very good, fresh and not greasy like some places.  Very good prices and excellent service.  A must try if you are in Indio.

data.title: Must try!
data.text: My favorite place to eat! Best Chinese food in Indio. Try their version of Mongolian Beef, Orange Chicken, Moo Gu Gai Pan, Spicy House Fried Rice, Walnut Shrimp and Combination Chow Fun.  Great price, excellent service and outstanding quality of food.
